info.title: Octez RPC
info.description: The RPC API served by the Octez node.

post.description: Remove an operation from the mempool if present, reverting its effect if it was applied. Add it to the set of banned operations to prevent it from being fetched/processed/injected in the future. Note: If the baker has already received the operation, then it's necessary to restart it to flush the operation from it.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

get.description: Get the configuration of the mempool filter. The minimal_fees are in mutez. Each field minimal_nanotez_per_xxx is a rational number given as a numerator and a denominator, e.g. "minimal_nanotez_per_gas_unit": [ "100", "1" ].

parameters.name: include_default
parameters.description: Show fields equal to their default value (set by default)

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Set the configuration of the mempool filter. **If any of the fields is absent from the input JSON, then it is set to the default value for this field (i.e. its value in the default configuration), even if it previously had a different value.** If the input JSON does not describe a valid configuration, then the configuration is left unchanged. Also return the new configuration (which may differ from the input if it had omitted fields or was invalid). You may call [./octez-client rpc get '/chains/main/mempool/filter?include_default=true'] to see an example of JSON describing a valid configuration.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

parameters.name: branch_delayed
parameters.description: Include branch delayed operations (set by default)

parameters.name: validation_pass
parameters.description: Include operations filtered by validation pass (all by default)

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

parameters.name: branch_refused
parameters.description: Include branch refused operations (true by default)

parameters.name: branch_delayed
parameters.description: Include branch delayed operations (true by default)

parameters.name: validation_pass
parameters.description: Include operations filtered by validation pass (all by default)

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Request the operations of our peers or a specific peer if specified via a query parameter.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Clear the set of banned operations.

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

post.description: Remove an operation from the set of banned operations (nothing happens if it was not banned).

schema.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

016-PtMumbai.block_header.alpha.full_hea.title: Shell header
016-PtMumbai.block_header.alpha.full_hea.description: Block header's shell-related content. It contains information such as the block level, its predecessor and timestamp.

016-PtMumbai.contract_id.title: A contract handle
016-PtMumbai.contract_id.description: A contract notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts. Can be a base58 implicit contract hash or a base58 originated contract hash.

016-PtMumbai.contract_id.originated.title: A contract handle -- originated account
016-PtMumbai.contract_id.originated.description: A contract notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts. Can be a base58 originated contract hash.

016-PtMumbai.entrypoint.title: entrypoint
016-PtMumbai.entrypoint.description: Named entrypoint to a Michelson smart contract

016-PtMumbai.smart_rollup_address.title: A smart rollup address
016-PtMumbai.smart_rollup_address.description: A smart rollup is identified by a base58 address starting with sr1

016-PtMumbai.tx_rollup_id.title: A tx rollup handle
016-PtMumbai.tx_rollup_id.description: A tx rollup notation as given to an RPC or inside scripts, is a base58 tx rollup hash

Inbox_list_hash.title: A merkle root hash for inboxes (Base58Check-encoded)

Message_result_list_hash.title: A merklised message result list hash (Base58Check-encoded)

Operation_list_list_hash.title: A list of list of operations (Base58Check-encoded)

Signature.Public_key.title: A Ed25519, Secp256k1, or P256 public key (Base58Check-encoded)

Signature.Public_key_hash.title: A Ed25519, Secp256k1, P256, or BLS public key hash (Base58Check-encoded)

Signature.V1.title: A Ed25519, Secp256k1, P256 or BLS signature (Base58Check-encoded)

Smart_rollup_commitment_hash.title: The hash of a commitment of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

Smart_rollup_state_hash.title: The hash of the VM state of a smart rollup (Base58Check-encoded)

bignum.title: Big number
bignum.description: Decimal representation of a big number

error.description: The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

error_opt.description: An optional error-trace (None indicates no error). The full list of errors is available with the global RPC `GET errors`

fitness.title: Block fitness
fitness.description: The fitness, or score, of a block, that allow the Tezos to decide which chain is the best. A fitness value is a list of byte sequences. They are compared as follows: shortest lists are smaller; lists of the same length are compared according to the lexicographical order.

oneOf.title: Prim__generic
oneOf.description: Generic primitive (any number of args with or without annotations)

positive_bignum.title: Positive big number
positive_bignum.description: Decimal representation of a positive big number

timestamp.protocol.description: A timestamp as seen by the protocol: second-level precision, epoch based.

unistring.title: Universal string representation
unistring.description: Either a plain UTF8 string, or a sequence of bytes for strings that contain invalid byte sequences.
